description.narrative: Sustainable Movement- online course is for learning how sport can be used as a tool to achieve the United Nations Agenda2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG's) and how the SDG's can be implemented in practice in the domain of sports. The online course i s open and free for physical education professionals and anyone interested in sports and sustainable development. The pedagogical and theoretical framework of the online course is Transformational Learning Theory (TL) which is aiming to empower and motivat e people to engage in critical thinking and self-reflection following exposure to the new information / ideas. Sustainable Movement- online course is observing and reflecting the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG's) through the speciality of sports and de velopment. The course expands people's understanding of global development challenges regarding poverty reduction and climate change especially enhancing the four cross-cutting objectives of Finnish Development Policy and Cooperation which are: gender equ ality non-discrimination climate resilience and low emission development. These thematic issues will be explored through intersectionality and critics of feminism and postcolonialism. Yet understanding how sport and development domain can tackle these iss ues. Furthermore the key idea of the course is to find concrete solutions and alternatives to how sports professionals can apply the Sustainable Development Goals into practice. Besides the online course there will be a special workshop-training for the st udents of higher-education of sport studies (Bachelor of sport studies / physical education / social sciences of sport) the physical education teachers of Finnish Sport Institutes students of well-being instructor training for immigrants and LiiKe - Sports + Development volunteers and trainees. These workshops will be constructed on top of the information gained through the online course aiming to deepen the knowledge and engagement toward sustainable development practices and the relation of sports and dev elopment and its benefits.
